intro: Icacorea hatoana, commonly known as the Hatoana hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant features showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically bright red or orange in color. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture. Icacorea hatoana is often found growing in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii.
